metadata.title: CVE-2023-6936 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In wolfSSL prior to 5.6.6, if callback functions are enabled (via theWOLFSSL_CALLBACKS flag), then a malicious TLS client or network attackercan trigger a buffer over-read on the heap of 5 bytes (WOLFSSL_CALLBACKS isonly intended for debugging).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6936` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl42t64 - 5.6.6-1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.6-1.2').
